data.title: International Exchange and Study Abroad
data.meta_description: Study at the Royal Conservatoire of Scotland through International Exchange and Study Abroad programmes. RCS links with North American, European, Asian, Australian institutions. Learn more here.
data.text:
If you would like to come to the Royal Conservatoire of Scotland on an exchange we actively encourage your ambitions. RCS welcomes applications from students from its partner institutions as part of International Exchange and Study Abroad.

Stepping into new and unexpected experiences is a vital part of growing and developing as an artist and because RCS has students from over 60 countries, you will be part of a thriving international community of students.

About International Exchange

The Royal Conservatoire of Scotland is linked to several international institutions. International exchanges enable our students to study in North America, Asia or Australia as part of their course and for students from international partner institutions to study in Glasgow. If you’re from one of the Conservatoire’s international exchange partner institutions you can apply to study in Glasgow for part or all of an academic year. You should apply via the EASY system with the consent of the International Relations Coordinator in your home institution.

International Exchange Learning Agreement (inbound applicants) 2023-24

Study Abroad via The College of Global Studies at Arcadia University

Students registered with a select list of US colleges and universities can apply to study at the Royal Conservatoire for one term (September to December), two terms (January to June) or a full academic year (September to June) via Arcadia University’s Study Abroad programme. We accept applications for Study Abroad via Arcadia onto the following programmes of study:

BA Production Arts and Design

BA Production Technology and Management

BA Modern Ballet

Bachelor of Music (Performance, Jazz or Composition)

To see if you’re eligible to apply please go to Arcadia Abroad

If you’re able to apply you will be advised of the application process by Arcadia.

Study Abroad Learning Agreement for those applying via Arcadia

Study Abroad for Muhlenberg College Applicants

Students registered at Muhlenberg College can apply to study at the Royal Conservatoire for one term (September to December), two terms (January to June) or a full academic year (September to June). We accept applications from Muhlenberg students onto the following programmes of study:

BA Production Arts and Design

BA Production Technology and Management

BA Modern Ballet

Bachelor of Music (Hons) Performance

To check whether you’re eligible to apply please check with the relevant member of staff in your department at Muhlenberg College.

Muhlenberg College Guide for Applicants 2022-2023

Muhlenberg College Student Learning Agreement
